column4: are there any tools available to convert my m4p (iTunes files) to mp3?
did you try ffmpeg?
I thought I did...  I will take a look right now though.  It has that ability I take it?
ffmpeg -formats
Means it can decode your mp4 and encode to mp3
excellent news, thank you much!
wait, it's m4p or mp4?
I thought you said mp4, m4p is a infected (DRM) itnues file.  You can't
yeah...  :( m4p
one suggestion I known is to convert them (with itunes) to m4a
is there a Noteburner or similar software for linux?
you can look on google, there are some suggestions for converting them.

yup. My other option is to use Audacity and record the stream as I play the files from iTunes via Wine, however Audacity isn't picking up my output
the oldest trick is to burn them to CD, then rip the CDs.  There are some windows apps that setup a virtual drive, and then allow you to read it.
yes, none are free, which is ok, but they all seem rather overpriced at $40+
you could always send apple an invoice for it. :)
don't think I have many choices though, I may spend some time just looking for what I want and downloading it again (via less than acceptable means).

good luck
